# endPDFPage()

**Instance Method**

Ends the current page in the PDF graphics context.

## Declaration

```swift
func endPDFPage()
```

## Discussion

You can call [doc://com.apple.coregraphics/documentation/CoreGraphics/CGContext/endPDFPage()] only after you call the function [doc://com.apple.coregraphics/documentation/CoreGraphics/CGContext/beginPDFPage(_:)].

## Managing a PDF Graphics Context

- **beginPDFPage(_:)**: Begins a new page in a PDF graphics context.
- **addDestination(_:at:)**: Sets a destination to jump to when a point in the current page of a PDF graphics context is clicked.
- **setDestination(_:for:)**: Sets a destination to jump to when a rectangle in the current PDF page is clicked.
- **setURL(_:for:)**: Sets the URL associated with a rectangle in a PDF graphics context.
- **addDocumentMetadata(_:)**: Associates custom metadata with the PDF document.
- **closePDF()**: Closes a PDF document.
